programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Aaron Wingate lost his wife and son in a river boat fire years ago. The boy was never found. Wingate hires two private detectives who come to North Fork and decide that Mark will fit the bill. Lucas must fight for custody.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: A pretty young widow named Ann Dodd passes through North Fork on her way to claim her inheritance. She and Lucas are immediately attracted to each other, but danger awaits as other heirs try to take Ann's life to get the inheritance for themselves.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: While hunting, Colly Vane encounters a dangerous outlaw, The Domino Kid, who forces Vane to shoot him. When he brings the body back to town, it's discovered he was shot in the back. Instead of being a hero, Vane faces danger.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Kansas Sawyer is Lucas' friend who was cheated in a horse-trading deal. Lucas investigates Colonel Bourbon's operation and discovers his illegal process. He also learns that the horse Sawyer bought was stolen and is being sought after by outlaws.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: Cheyenne is guarding a gold shipment on a train. A gang robs the train and shoots a man dead. Before he passes away, the man names Cheyenne as the gang's leader. Cheyenne must clear his name.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: Cheyenne helps his friend Tuk deliver equipment across private property to a mine. However, they run into major problems when they encounter a detestable landowner who wants the equipment for himself.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: The guys are back in the saddle on The Cowboy Way! Their dreams of making it big have finally arrived with a million-dollar business opportunity, but only if they can come up with half the cash. While the cowboys struggle with how to raise the money, Bubba is torn if he should ask his father-in-law for help. Booger teaches Matthew to be a real cowboy and gives him his first pony! But when Jaclyn misses this big milestone, she questions if her demanding job is keeping her from her family. And finally, Cody's mission to teach kids about the importance of ranching leads him to take on the Cattlemen's Association. How far will he go to make his point?

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: It's back to basics on The Cowboy Way as the guys work to rotate cattle off a lightning-struck field to fresh grass, but the routine wrangle suddenly heads south as the herd scatters, jumping and taking down part of a fence. Kaley wonders about finances and if she should find work, while Bubba invests in a starter herd for daughter Andie's Cowgirl College Fund. Jaclyn rushes to prepare for Matthew's 4th birthday party and anxiously waits for news after a job interview. Booger's parents have a special birthday surprise for Matthew. As the Cattlemen's Association Ambassador, Cody gets a call from a local farmer and meets their autistic son Tristan. Misty gives Cody an idea how to share the cowboy way lifestyle with this special boy.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas stands guard at the North Fork Bank when $50,000 arrives in a specially designed stagecoach strongbox. Two gunmem who plan to ambush and rob the stage take Milly and Mark hostage in the general store, which doubles as their headquarters.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Two prison wagon drivers stop at the McCain Ranch looking for whiskey. Lucas refuses since they are taking a murderer named Rudy Croft to be hanged in Yuma. Later, Croft escapes and the guards take Lucas as their prisoner.

programme.title: The Tall Tales of Jim Bridger
programme.desc: When Jim Bridger's second-in-command begins enforcing camp discipline with brutal violence, one trapper pushes back, and a showdown seems inevitable. Can Bridger intervene before the situation turns from mutual hostility into cold-blooded murder?

programme.title: The Tall Tales of Jim Bridger
programme.desc: Haunted by the memory of leaving a man to die, mountain man Jim Bridger is determined not to repeat the mistake. When his trapping party runs out of water while crossing a barren desert, Bridger struggles desperately to keep his companions alive.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: Once a feared gunfighter and sheriff, the legendary Bat Masterson is now working as a newspaperman. He heads west again to uncover the real story of Pearl Hart, the first woman to rob a stagecoach in the Old West. Masterson tracks down Pearl's partner-in-crime, Joe Boot, who shares every daring and surprising detail from his wild days with the notorious Bandit Queen. In a time when outlaws and gunslingers captured the fascination of the American public, Pearl Hart was living proof that in the Wild West a woman could be just as infamous as a man.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: Bat Masterson, legendary gunfighter and sheriff, is now working as a newspaperman. He heads west again to uncover the real story behind the most brazen bank robbery of the Old West. Masterson tracks down the sole survivor of the Dalton Gang, who relives the horrible day when they attempted to rob two banks at the same time. The youngest of the Dalton brothers, Emmett Dalton describes how the gang was gunned down as they tried to make their getaway. Despite numerous gunshot wounds, Emmett lived to serve his time in prison and renounce his life of crime.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.sub-title: Lucien Maxwell: Legend of New Mexico
programme.desc: Having explored the frontier with his good friend Kit Carson, Lucien Maxwell is eager to settle down with his family. But before he can establish a ranching empire in New Mexico, Maxwell must first survive a deadly clash with the Jicarilla Apache.

programme.title: Ultimate Cowboy Showdown
programme.desc: Now down to ten cowboys, the competition continues with an all-new immunity challenge that focuses on a whole different aspect of cowboyin' - business acumen. The contestants must prove they know the cattle market by estimating the value of various livestock at auction. Trace asks the contestants to continue to train the colts from the last elimination challenge, but they struggle to develop a plan that will work for everyone. The elimination challenge tests the contestants' team strategy, roping, and speed. Each team has forty-five minutes to collect fifteen gold ear tags from mixed herds in two different pastures. Frustrations build when the green team has trouble with the pens, and a cow escapes during the blue team's run. As the competition intensifies, one cowboy tries to get rid of his biggest competition. Unimpressed by how the teams handled the challenge, Trace shakes things up by sending two cowboys home.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: A gunman impersonating Jimmy as Wild Bill Hickok, robs banks in the territory. Jimmy goes undercover to find out who is framing him. To catch the gunman in the act, the riders position themselves at the next bank that he plans to rob.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Aaron Wingate lost his wife and son in a river boat fire years ago. The boy was never found. Wingate hires two private detectives who come to North Fork and decide that Mark will fit the bill. Lucas must fight for custody.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: A pretty young widow named Ann Dodd passes through North Fork on her way to claim her inheritance. She and Lucas are immediately attracted to each other, but danger awaits as other heirs try to take Ann's life to get the inheritance for themselves.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: While hunting, Colly Vane encounters a dangerous outlaw, The Domino Kid, who forces Vane to shoot him. When he brings the body back to town, it's discovered he was shot in the back. Instead of being a hero, Vane faces danger.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Kansas Sawyer is Lucas' friend who was cheated in a horse-trading deal. Lucas investigates Colonel Bourbon's operation and discovers his illegal process. He also learns that the horse Sawyer bought was stolen and is being sought after by outlaws.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: Cheyenne is guarding a gold shipment on a train. A gang robs the train and shoots a man dead. Before he passes away, the man names Cheyenne as the gang's leader. Cheyenne must clear his name.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: Cheyenne helps his friend Tuk deliver equipment across private property to a mine. However, they run into major problems when they encounter a detestable landowner who wants the equipment for himself.

programme.title: Kansas Pacific
programme.desc: With talks of a Civil War brewing, Southern saboteurs know they must keep Northern forces from using the U.S. train system. They devise a daring and dangerous plan to stop and capture a railroad engine, preventing the completion of a railroad line.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: When homesteaders keep cutting down her fences to access grazing land and water, a widowed landowner teams up with famed Texas Ranger Ira Aten to protect her property. Aten hopes his explosive plan of action will force the cutters to compromise.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Mark takes a job on new neighbor Will Temple's ranch but is taken back by Temple's badly scarred face. When a cavalry officer stops by the McCain Ranch looking for a deserter who committed murder, both Mark and Lucas question who Temple really is.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: While repairing a fence on his property, Lucas witnesses a murder. The killer, Corey Hazlett, is the son of a wealthy rancher named Frank Hazlett. When Lucas agrees to testify at Corey's trial, there are threats to harm Mark.

programme.title: Wagon Train
programme.desc: While on the trail, Annie MacGregor and her Scottish family's wagon wheel breaks. The family patriarch doesn't want any help until Major Adams' wagon train stops. Conflict arises when they practice their traditions, including playing bagpipes.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: Bat Masterson, former gunfighter and sheriff, is now working as a newspaperman. He heads west again to uncover the story behind one of the country's greatest train robberies. Although Butch and Sundance are long gone, Masterson tracks down Sundance's former girlfriend, Etta Place, to draw out more details. To pull off the audacious robbery, they used official Union Pacific lanterns to signal the train and fool the engineer into believing a bridge was out. As Etta reluctantly relives the events of the robbery and its aftermath, it's obvious that she is still smitten by Sundance after all of these years.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.sub-title: The Legend of the Blue-Eyed Apache
programme.desc: When eleven-year-old Herman Lehmann is torn away from his frontier home by an Apache raiding party, he must adapt in order to survive. He soon forgets the life he unwillingly left behind and is adopted by an Apache family. For close to a decade, he lives as a Native American, learning their language and customs. Eventually, he even joins the same type of raiding party that separated him from his family. Though the years pass by, Herman's mother never gives up hope that she will be reunited with her son. One day, she hears a rumor of a blue-eyed Apache now living on a reservation. Could this be her long-lost son? Some years later, Bat Masterson, legendary gunfighter-turned-newspaperman, interviews Herman's mother to uncover the real story of the blue-eyed Apache.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.sub-title: Bill Hamilton: The Last Mountain Man
programme.desc: Coming of age on the frontier, young Bill Hamilton joins Old Bill Williams on an epic adventure during the final days of the fur trade. The last true mountain man, Hamilton's courage is tested when he faces an epic showdown with Bannock warriors.

programme.title: Ultimate Cowboy Showdown
programme.desc: With only eight cowboys left, the competition is neck-and-neck, and everyone has their eyes set on the immunity buckle. The immunity challenge tests their speed and control on horseback in a tournament-style battle, and they go head-to-head until only one remains. Two teammates, who have had it out for each other from the start, decide to set their differences aside for the team's greater good, and to their surprise, they work well together. In the elimination challenge, each team has to sort a herd of cattle by their ear tag colors and drive them into three separate corrals. The blue team comes together to implement a strategy that proves to be effective. The green team makes a risky decision that could cost them the challenge. During elimination, a contestant throws their biggest rival under the bus yet again. Trace sends another cowboy packing.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: A cholera outbreak spreads fear among the townspeople of Sweetwater. They blame a defenseless, mentally disabled boy named Danny, who traveled to town with a medicine show. Now, the riders must protect him from an angry mob of citizens.

programme.title: Abilene Town
programme.desc: It's the late 1800s and a marshal must stop a volatile and growing conflict between homesteaders and cattle drivers in his small town on the Kansas frontier.
